page.title: 08Orton Longueville Church.
page.content: The Holy Trinity church is in Orton Longueville, only 100m along The Village from the main A605 Peterborough-Oundle Road. The church is over 600 years old, and is the oldest building in the village. It has a large graveyard with lots of graves, with readable headstones over 200 years old. Inside the church is a grave of a knight. The knight was said to have been fighting the Danish soldiers when a sword split his side. His guts all fell out but he tied them around his left arm, so he could fight on and win. He eventually died. Other interesting parts are the windows, many of them are stained glass. There are many plaques inside the church, in memory of parishioners and one in memory of a clergyman.
